174.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram and shared a picture of his surprise visit to his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's set. He also shared an old picture with his father. Along with the picture, Abhishek wrote, "Some things never change...Surprise visits to his set will always be one of my...favourite things to do."

175.title: Bombay HC orders probe against inspector who ensured minor's trial as adult
175.article_body: The Bombay HC has ordered a probe into allegations that a Mumbai Police inspector misled the Juvenile Justice Board to ensure a minor was tried as an adult. The minor, arrested in a murder case, was allegedly targeted as his father could not meet the officer's demand for ₹50,000. The boy had been lodged in the Thane Central Jail.

176.title: Baba Ramdev to launch IPO of 4 firms under Patanjali brand: Report
176.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev would launch the IPO of four companies under the Patanjali brand, a report said. The companies that'll be listed on the stock market during the next five years include Patanjali Ayurved, Patanjali Wellness, Patanjali Medicine and Patanjali Lifestyle. During an interview, Ramdev said that his company is planning to sell 6% promoters' stake in Patanjali Foods.

177.title: We've rejected Reliance Infra's ₹500-cr arbitration claim: Adani Transmission
177.article_body: Adani Transmission Ltd (ATL) on Monday said Reliance Infrastructure Ltd's ₹500-crore arbitration claim over a dispute under the share purchase agreement (SPA) in December 2021 has been rejected by it. These are afterthoughts and based on untenable positions, ATL said. It added that Reliance Infrastructure hasn't yet settled Adani Electricity Mumbai Ltd's significantly larger claims under the SPA.

178.title: NZ Rugby fined for not having 40% representation of women on board
178.article_body: New Zealand Rugby Chairman Stewart Mitchell has confirmed that the board has been penalised for not meeting Sport New Zealand's requirement for having a 40% representation of women on the board. According to a report, the country's apex body for rugby will lose $172,060 in funding from the government. Currently, three out of nine board members of NZR are female.

179.title: Woman arrested for stealing child from Mumbai to increase income
179.article_body: A 35-year-old Delhi woman was arrested for stealing the child of a Mumbai's Borivali-based couple in order to increase her source of income. Police say the couple had let the woman live with them for three days before she took off with the three-year-old boy. Police arrested the woman when she was trying to board a train from Dadar station.

180.title: Switzerland identifies site for nuclear waste storage facility
180.article_body: Switzerland's nuclear waste authority has identified a site for setting up the country's first permanent nuclear waste storage facility near the German border. The Swiss government, however, will need the parliament's approval before it can sign off on the proposed site. The proposal could also face a possible referendum. Construction of the storage facility is estimated to begin in 2045.

181.title: 4 coaches of passenger train derail in Odisha's Koraput; none hurt
181.article_body: At least four coaches of Visakhapatnam-Kirandul passenger special train derailed in Odisha's Koraput district on Monday, the East Coast Railway (ECoR) said in a statement. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far, officials said. "All passengers managed to get down safely from the train," Divisional Railway Manager Anup Satpathy said.

182.title: Sri Lanka showed true character as a unit to win Asia Cup 2022: Yuvraj
182.article_body: Congratulating Sri Lanka following their Asia Cup 2022 win, Yuvraj Singh said that they deserved to win the tournament. "After losing to Afghanistan in the first game [Sri Lanka] showed true character as a unit to win the tournament...well done skipper," he added. Sri Lanka won five matches in a row after losing to Afghanistan in their first match.

183.title: No reasons for Iran to reject EU's offer on nuclear deal: Germany
183.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Iran has no reason to reject the proposals by European countries on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal. It is regrettable that there has been no positive response to the proposal by Iran yet, Scholz added. Earlier this month, Iran sent its latest response to the EU's "final text" drafted for the pact's revival.

184.title: Pvt jets not allowed, world leaders to take bus to Queen's funeral in London: Report
184.article_body: World leaders and VIPs arriving in the UK for Queen Elizabeth's funeral have been asked to take commercial flights instead of private jets to transport them, Politico reported, citing a document. The attendees, including US President Joe Biden, can't take helicopters or state cars to the funeral, Politico said. They'll reportedly be taken to London's Westminster Abbey on a bus.

185.title: I feel proud we managed to create great energy at cinemas: Ayan on Brahmastra
185.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra' has collected ₹225 crore worldwide within three days of its release, director Ayan Mukerji shared on Monday. "Brahmastra has gotten off to a great start with audiences over its first weekend," Ayan wrote, adding that he feels proud that the team "managed to create a great energy at...cinemas over the last three days".

186.title: Aaditya Thackeray could lose MCA membership for owing ₹7,941 in dues
186.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray and his cousin Varun Sardesai are among the 92 individuals who have defaulted on their annual membership fees of the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA), Kandivali. The MCA has written to the CEO asking for permission to cancel their memberships. Aaditya has a total outstanding of ₹7,941, while Sardesai's amount is pegged at ₹38,515.

187.title: Bodies of 3 teenage boys found from river after 3-day search in U'khand
187.article_body: The bodies of three boys, who were missing since September 10 in Uttarakhand's Pauri district, were found in a river on Monday. The boys, aged 13,15 and 16, had left their homes to stroll around the Duggada petrol pump area on a two-wheeler. The bodies were pulled out from the river with the help of ropes.

188.title: New sculptures installed in Pune to remain covered till inauguration: PCMC
188.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) installed sculptures across the city as part of a beautification process and they will remain covered till the inauguration, officials said. The project entails beautifying prominent chowks, and a team of artists from across the country was chosen to make sculptures using scrap material. Each sculpture will cost over ₹2 lakh, officials said.

189.title: BBMP begins demolition drive at 2 locations to clear stormwater drains
189.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started demolition drives at two locations in Bengaluru to clear stormwater drains following floods caused by heavy rains. While one BBMP team began demolitions in Mahadevapura zone, the other team started clearing parts of Ragam megastore in AECS Layout. BBMP Chief Engineer Basavaraj Kabade said, "20 buildings have encroached near Spice Garden Layout."

190.title: Does anyone want me to do it again?: Brie on playing 'Captain Marvel'
190.article_body: Actress Brie Larson, during D23 Expo, was asked how long she would play 'Captain Marvel' in MCU films. To this, she replied, "Does anyone want me to do it again? I...don't know. I don't have the answer to that." Brie first played the role in the 2019 film 'Captain Marvel'. She will next feature as Captain Marvel in 'The Marvels'.

191.title: 5 youths held for performing bike stunts in Chennai after video goes viral
191.article_body: Five bikers have been arrested for allegedly performing stunts on their bikes on Chennai road. A video showing the youths performing the stunts had gone viral. Twitter users had also tagged Chennai police and had called for action against the bikers. While two people were arrested on Saturday, police arrested three more accused on Sunday.

192.title: A weekend full of light: Alia as Brahmastra earns ₹225 cr worldwide in 3 days
192.article_body: As the worldwide box-office collection of 'Brahmastra' crossed ₹225 crore, Alia Bhatt took to Instagram on Monday to share a post thanking her fans. "A weekend full of light and our hearts full of love. So grateful for our audience," she wrote. The film was released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam on September 9.

193.title: Divorced man kidnaps girl to raise her as his child in Delhi; held
193.article_body: Delhi Police have rescued a four-year-old girl within 24 hours after she was kidnapped by a divorced man. The accused has been arrested and sent to judicial custody. "[He] is a divorcee and a drunkard. He wanted to raise the girl child as his own...But he got scared and had abandoned her on the way," a senior police official said.

194.title: 240 held for harassing women during Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad
194.article_body: Hyderabad's SHE Team arrested 240 people for allegedly misbehaving with women during the recently concluded festival of Ganesh Chaturthi. The arrested were found to be touching women inappropriately, stalking them, and taking their pictures near Ganesh pandals across the city. SHE Team members were clad in plain clothes and were secretly carrying cameras.

195.title: Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' sold for ₹125 cr to OTT platform: Report
195.article_body: The 'Ponniyin Selvan' franchise has reportedly been sold for ₹125 crore to an OTT platform. Filmmaker Mani Ratnam is the director of the two-film franchise. The first instalment of 'Ponniyin Selvan' will release on September 30. The film will feature Vikram, Karthi, Trisha Krishnan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.

196.title: Pakistan played well in Asia Cup, but not very well: Inzamam
196.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq said that Pakistan played "well" in the recently-concluded Asia Cup tournament, but not "very well". "Many of their (Pakistan) flaws were on show. They could not capitalize on the pressure, which helped them reduce Sri Lanka for 58-5 at one stage of the game," Inzamam said. He added that the Lankan pacers had done their "homework".

197.title: Ethereum blockchain may be upgraded this week to cut energy use by 99.9%: Report
197.article_body: Ethereum blockchain is expected to undergo a software upgrade this week to allow it to consume 99.95% lesser energy than it currently does to create ether tokens, Reuters reported. The Ethereum Foundation said the upgrade, known as 'The Merge', will take place between September 10-20. The upgrade may widen the technology's use and support ether token's price.

198.title: Someone in your office ate your dosa: Cong to Tejasvi Surya
198.article_body: Responding to BJP leader Tejasvi Surya's comment that he didn't receive the parcel of dosas sent by Congress, party leader Tejesh Kumar C said that someone in Surya's office ate his dosas. "It's been more than 24 hours & I still haven't received it. They can't deliver a dosa properly and they dream of delivering good governance!" Surya previously said.

199.title: 40-yr-old man stabs 25-yr-old woman for abusing his mother in Delhi
199.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed by her 40-year-old neighbour in Delhi's Sagarpur for abusing his mother, officials said on Monday. The accused was under the influence of alcohol during the altercation, said DCP (southwest) Manoj C said. The accused alleged the woman had abused his mother, which angered him, he said, adding that he used a kitchen knife.

200.title: School bus with students catches fire in Navi Mumbai, no casualty
200.article_body: A school bus carrying students caught fire in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar area on Monday, officials said, adding that no injuries were reported. Four students of a school, a staffer and a driver were present in the vehicle when it caught fire, a fire official said. The fire was doused within 15 minutes, the official added.

201.title: There's wave of happiness: UP Deputy CM as Gyanvapi suit held maintainable
201.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak said there is a wave of happiness after the Varanasi district court held that a group of Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside the Gyanvapi mosque was maintainable. "I'm receiving many phone calls expressing happiness," Pathak said. The Anjuman Committee had said that the Gyanvapi mosque is a Waqf property.

202.title: Pregnant woman carried on stretcher, delivers baby in forest in Maha
202.article_body: A pregnant tribal woman was carried on a makeshift stretcher due to lack of a proper road in a village in Maharashtra's Palghar district, officials said on Monday. The 21-year-old woman delivered the baby in a dense and dark forest in Maharashtra. A video of the woman being carried by some people surfaced on social media.

203.title: Tyres stolen from 3 cars in Delhi's Greater Kailash, probe on
203.article_body: Thieves in Delhi's Greater Kailash area stole tyres from at least three cars in the early hours of Monday, the police said, adding that the accused took all four tyres of one car. CCTV footage of the incident shows a man getting out of a car around 3 am, quickly removing tyres and then escaping.

204.title: Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa announced
204.article_body: The BCCI has announced Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa. Fast bowler Mohammad Shami, who has been named standby player for India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, features in squads for both series. Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Hardik Pandya have been included in squad for Australia T20Is, while they have been rested for South Africa T20Is.

205.title: Retail inflation rises to 7% in August after falling for 3 straight months
205.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), rose to 7% in the month of August after falling for three straight months, government data showed. The CPI stood at 6.71% in July, 7.01% in June and 7.04% in May. In April, the CPI had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

206.title: Man stabs 2 brothers over argument about a girl in Delhi, 1 dead
206.article_body: A 20-year-old man was declared dead, while his 21-year-old brother sustained injuries after their friend stabbed them over an argument about a girl in Delhi, officials said on Monday. The accused was in a relationship with the woman in question, said DCP (north) Sagar Singh Kalsi, adding that the victims had passed comments about her a few days back.

207.title: I will feature in season 2 of 'Duranga': Actor Amit Sadh
207.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has revealed that he will be featuring in the next season of 'Duranga'. "I am happy to see the outpouring of love for my cameo role in Duranga. I have huge admiration for the whole team...especially the cast who have worked so hard to make a complex series," he stated. Gulshan Devaiah featured in the first season.

208.title: UAE court rejects Danish extradition plea for fraud case accused
208.article_body: An Emirati court has ruled that the prime suspect in a $1.7 billion tax fraud case cannot be extradited to Denmark. Sanjay Shah is wanted by Danish authorities for his alleged involvement in one of Denmark's largest-ever fraud cases. The case pertains to an elaborate scheme as part of which ineligible foreign businesses claimed tax refunds from the Danish exchequer.

209.title: Vedanta picks Gujarat for its $20-bn joint venture with Foxconn: Report
209.article_body: Vedanta has picked Gujarat to set up a semiconductor plant under its $20-billion joint venture with Taiwan's Foxconn, Reuters reported. Vedanta reportedly obtained financial and non-financial subsidies, including cheap electricity, from Gujarat to build the semiconductor plants. Vedanta had sought 1,000 acres of land free-of-cost on a 99-year lease while lobbying for incentives with states.

210.title: Muslim petitioners to move HC in Gyanvapi case as Hindu suit held maintainable
210.article_body: After Varanasi district court agreed to hear Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside Gyanvapi mosque, Muslim petitioners said they'll move to the High Court. Uttar Pradesh Minority Minister Danish Azad Ansari said the court verdict should be respected. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee had questioned the maintainability of Hindu side's plea, saying the mosque was a Waqf property.

211.title: Ex-Gazprom unit to pay penalty for failed LNG deliveries to India: Official
211.article_body: A former unit of Russia's Gazprom will pay a penalty for the LNG cargoes it failed to deliver to India since early June, said an official. Under a 20-year contract, Gazprom Marketing and Trading Singapore was to supply 2.5 million tonnes of LNG to GAIL (India) this year and will now pay a penalty of 20% of the agreed price.

212.title: These 2 weeks have been incredible: Alcaraz on 1st Grand Slam win, no. 1 spot
212.article_body: After winning his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open and becoming the youngest men's world number one, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz tweeted, "These two weeks have been incredible and have included some very tough matches." He added, "Thank you NYC for the support...energy on court is impossible to explain! And thank you everyone on the other side of the world."

213.title: Article 370 will be restored in J&K: Mufti on Azad's can't be restored remark
213.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Monday responded to Ghulam Nabi Azad's "Article 370 cannot be restored" remark and said that it was his "personal opinion". "There are voices in J&K who believe Article 370 will be reinstated," she said. Congress is making false promises if they're talking about restoring Article 370, Azad previously said.

214.title: Man allegedly rapes dancer on pretext of taking audition in Gurugram
214.article_body: A man allegedly raped a 37-year-old professional dancer on the pretext of taking a dance audition in Gurugram. The woman alleged that he also filmed the act and had physical relations with her several times. "He threatened to kill me when I resisted...After...long time, I decided to move to police," she added. Police have registered a case into the matter.

215.title: Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022 announced
215.article_body: The BCCI today announced the 15-member Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Rohit Sharma will be captaining India in a major ICC tournament for the first time. The squad includes Harshal Patel, who will be featuring in his maiden T20 World Cup. Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who wasn't selected for last year's T20 World Cup, features in the squad.

216.title: Richa Chadha, Ali Fazal to tie the knot on October 6 in Mumbai: Report
216.article_body: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are reportedly getting married on October 6 in Mumbai. According to Pinkvilla, the pre-wedding festivities will begin at Delhi Gymkhana Club on September 30 and continue for three days. Mehendi and sangeet ceremony will take place on October 1. Reportedly, a reception will be held on October 7 at a Mumbai hotel for Bollywood celebrities.

217.title: 20 antique idols seized from French national's residence in Tamil Nadu
217.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Idol Wing CID seized 20 idols from the residence of a French national in Auroville city. An attempt to smuggle antique artefacts out of the country was planned before the officials raided the accused's residence. The search was initiated following information about a handicrafts shop illegally dealing in stolen antique artefacts belonging to Tamil Nadu.

218.title: External Affairs Minister signs condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II
218.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar signed the condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II at British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis's residence on Monday. "She will be long remembered as a friend and well-wisher of India," Jaishankar said. She was the longest-serving monarch of the United Kingdom and the second longest in world history.

219.title: Bank watchman steals guard's ATM card in Pune, escapes with ₹90,000
219.article_body: A watchman employed at Bank of Baroda's Kalewadi branch allegedly stole the ATM card of a 76-year-old security guard and withdrew ₹90,000 without his consent. The victim used to take the accused's help in withdrawing money, for which he shared his card details with him. The accused swiped the card at different ATMs, the investigating officer said.

220.title: Inventor behind Amazon's Alexa raises $20 mn for new AI startup
220.article_body: The inventor of various technologies used by Amazon Inc's Alexa, William Tunstall-Pedoe, has raised $20 million for a new Artificial Intelligence (AI) startup called Unlikely AI. Amadeus Capital Partners, Octopus Ventures and former Google CFO Patrick Pichette, who is currently a Twitter board member, are backing the startup. Tunstall-Pedoe left Amazon in 2016 and was advising AI companies.

221.title: Their ecosystem burnt alive 59 karsevaks in Godhra: Surya on Congress' post
221.article_body: Reacting to Congress' burning khaki shorts post, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised the party and claimed that Congress' ecosystem burnt alive 59 karsevaks in Godhra in 2002. "Congress' fires lit in the past have burnt them in most of India. The remaining embers in Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh will also be reduced to ashes very soon," said Surya.

222.title: $7.75 million payment to whistleblower didn't breach deal with Musk: Twitter
222.article_body: Responding to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter has said that the $7.75 million payment made to a whistleblower didn't breach any conditions of its $44 billion buyout agreement with Musk. Musk’s lawyers had earlier said that Twitter's failure to seek Musk’s consent for Peiter Zatko's payment violated the merger agreement, thereby stating it as another reason to end the deal.

223.title: $85 mn round fell apart at final moment: CEO of Pak-based startup that shut down
223.article_body: Pakistan-based e-commerce startup Airlift collapsed in July after an $85 million funding round "fell apart at the final moment", CEO Usman Gul told Bloomberg. This was Pakistan's largest-ever funding round at a record valuation of $275 million. A lead investor pulled its commitment, leaving Airlift with no capital to continue and forcing it to abruptly shut down, Gul said.

224.title: BMC introduces 'Bluetooth enabled' stethoscopes in 2 Mumbai hospitals
224.article_body: The BMC, with the help of a start-up, has introduced 'Bluetooth enabled' stethoscopes in two civic-run major hospitals, Sion and BYL Nair Hospitals. The digital stethoscope, AyuSynk, will detect remote auscultation (listening to chest sounds). This will allow doctors to maintain a safe distance in the case of infectious diseases, said Dr Neelam Andrade, the director of major civic hospitals.

225.title: Centre, states trying to control lumpy skin disease in cattle: PM
225.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said the Centre, along with state governments, is trying hard to control the lumpy skin disease (LSD) in cattle. He noted "there has been a loss of livestock due to the disease across many states in India". Thousands of cattle have reportedly died due to the disease in over eight states, including Gujarat and Haryana.

226.title: TMC MP's relative reaches ED office at 12:30 am after 'typo', pic surfaces
226.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee's sister-in-law, Maneka Gambhir, reached the Enforcement Directorate office at 12:30 am on Monday. A picture of her standing outside the locked office surfaced online. The central agency called the notice a 'typographical error'. A fresh notice for 12:30 pm was issued, after which she appeared before the agency on Monday afternoon.

227.title: Sanjay Dutt charges ₹10 crore for his next film with Vijay: Report
227.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt is reportedly charging ₹10 crore for an upcoming action thriller film which will also feature Vijay. The 63-year-old actor will be seen in a negative role in the upcoming project, according to the report. The yet-untitled film will reportedly be directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, who also helmed Kamal Haasan-starrer action film 'Vikram'.

228.title: Hostel warden arrested for sexually harassing 7 minor boys in Hyd
228.article_body: A 35-year-old warden was arrested on Sunday in Hyderabad, after as many as seven students alleged that he touched them inappropriately, officials said on Monday. According to reports, the accused forced the students to watch pornographic content on his phone. Furthermore, the accused used to abuse children who slept alone by touching them and sleeping beside them.

229.title: Congratulations for your 1st Grand Slam, no. 1 spot: Nadal to Alcaraz
229.article_body: Rafael Nadal congratulated fellow Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz for his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open and the world number one ranking, saying it's the "culmination of your first great season". Nadal tweeted, "Great effort Casper Ruud...Tough luck today but amazing tournament and season!" The 19-year-old Spaniard beat Norwegian Ruud 6-4, 2-6, 7-6(7-1), 6-3 in the final.

230.title: Had Bhanuka scored at slower pace, his 71 would’ve been of no use: Inzamam
230.article_body: Talking about the importance of strike rate in T20s, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said that had Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa scored at a slower pace against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 final, then their total would've been around 140 runs. "So, [those 71] runs would've been of no use," he added. Bhanuka smashed 71*(45), helping Sri Lanka post 170/6.

231.title: No alliance with any topiwalla: Gujarat BTP leader Vasava
231.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) founder Chhotubhai Vasava said that his party won't have an association with any topiwalla, be it the ones wearing saffron caps or those donning white caps with a broom symbol. "All parties have ignored the issues of tribals," he added. Notably, BTP has been in an alliance with Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) since May.

232.title: Take back power reforms for the sake of poor people: KCR to Centre
232.article_body: Telangana CM KCR expressed disappointment over the Electricity (Amendment) Bill, 2022 and urged the Centre to take back the reforms. "You made three wrong laws against farmers, you took them back and apologised...So before people raise their voices again, I request you to take back reforms you have introduced for the sake of our poor and SC/ST people," said KCR.

233.title: Ram Temple's construction cost ₹1800 cr, space for seers to be made: Trust
233.article_body: An estimated cost of ₹1,800 crore will be incurred to build the Ram temple in Ayodhya, officials of the trust said. The general secretary of the trust said that the trust has also decided to make space for idols of prominent Hindu seers and the main characters from the Ramayana period in the temple complex.

234.title: Govt may invite EoIs for Container Corp of India's sale in Q3 FY23: Report
234.article_body: Centre may invite expressions of interest (EoIs) for strategic sale of Container Corporation of India (CONCOR) in Q3 FY23, CNBC TV18 reported. The Cabinet had approved the divestment of Centre's 30.8% stake in CONCOR, which is currently owned by Indian Railways, in November 2019. This comes after Indian Railways' land license fees was cut from 6% to 1.5%.

235.title: Adani Realty in advanced talks with DB Realty for merger deal: Report
235.article_body: Adani Realty is in advanced talks with Mumbai-based DB Realty for a merger deal, according to reports. The merger could be one of India's largest real-estate deals. The merger would reportedly aid Adani Realty in becoming a listed firm. Adani is likely to infuse more funds into DB Realty, which would result into a fresh equity issuance to new investors.

236.title: How much prize money did the Asia Cup 2022 winners and runners-up get?
236.article_body: Sri Lanka, who won the Asia Cup for the sixth time, received a total prize money of $150,000. Meanwhile, Pakistan, who finished runners-up at Asia Cup 2022, won a prize money of $75,000. Further, Sri Lanka all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga, who was named Player of the Asia Cup 2022, received $15,000 for the award.

237.title: I’ve never let his image be heavy on me: Sunny on Dharmendra
237.article_body: Bollywood actor Sunny Deol, son of veteran actor Dharmendra, said he has never let his father's image be heavy on him. Sunny, who made his debut with 'Betaab' in 1983, said he knew he had to pave a path of his own. On the work front, Sunny will be next seen in R Balki's 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist'.

238.title: Woman loses control of scooter, dies after falling in drain in B'luru
238.article_body: A 23-year-old woman died after she lost control of her scooter and fell into a drain in Bengaluru on Sunday. The accident took place at Banaswadi when the woman from Nepal was travelling with a male friend to Hennur at around 12.30 am. She was taken to a hospital where doctors declared her brought dead.

239.title: Missing student's body found with throat slit in West Bengal, friend held
239.article_body: The body of a 19-year-old missing engineering student has been found with the throat slit in West Bengal's Illambazar. The victim went missing on Saturday and his father received a ransom call for ₹30 lakh. The accused, who was friends with the victim, required money and made the latter consume liquor before killing him and making the ransom call.

240.title: Asia Cup win will help T20 WC 2022 preparation: Sri Lanka captain Shanaka
240.article_body: Following Sri Lanka's Asia Cup title, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said winning the tournament will help the team's preparation for the T20 World Cup, beginning next month. Sri Lanka beat Pakistan by 23 runs to win their sixth Asia Cup title. Sri Lanka will begin their T20 World Cup campaign with a qualifying match against Namibia on October 16.

241.title: Mumbai taxi, auto drivers to go on indefinite strike from Thursday
241.article_body: Over 48,000 taxi drivers and two lakh autorickshaw drivers in Mumbai, will go on an indefinite strike from September 15, Thursday, seeking a hike in fares, the drivers' union said. "Our demand is to increase the minimum taxi fare to ₹35 from the existing ₹25," said AL Quadros, General Secretary of Mumbai Taximen's Union.

242.title: German minister rejects Ukraine's demands to send main battle tanks
242.article_body: German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht has again rejected Ukraine's demand to send main battle tanks to support its troops amid the war with Russia. "No country has delivered Western-built infantry fighting vehicles or main battle tanks so far," she said. She added that Germany agrees with its partners that it will not take such action unilaterally.

243.title: Hope to constantly surprise: Kingsley on playing Trevor in 'Wonder Man'
243.article_body: Actor Ben Kingsley, who is reprising his role of Trevor Slattery in the upcoming Marvel Cinematic Universe series 'Wonder Man', said he hopes to "constantly surprise and refresh" as an artiste. The series will focus on the Marvel character Simon Williams, who plays the titular role. Ben had previously played Trevor in 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings'.

244.title: Indian players are picking injuries outside field, no one is addressing that: Sehwag
244.article_body: Referring to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's injury, Virender Sehwag said Indian players are getting injured outside the field and no one is addressing the issue. "[This] means the things that are happening outside or in the gym need to be addressed," added Sehwag. "Once you're in the Indian team...gym is not as important as skills," he further said.

245.title: India's milk production growth 3-times higher than global average: PM
245.article_body: Addressing the inauguration event of International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit, PM Narendra Modi said that the country's annual milk production growth is three times higher than the global average. "India produced 146 million tonnes of milk in 2014. It has now increased to 210 million tonnes. That is, an increase of about 44 per cent," he said.

246.title: Guj auto driver invites Kejriwal to dinner, he says 'Will you come to pick me up at hotel?'
246.article_body: An autorickshaw driver, Vikram Dantani, on Monday invited AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal for dinner at his home during AAP's town hall meeting with autorickshaw drivers before state polls. The Delhi CM said, "Will you come to pick me up at my hotel in your autorickshaw?" Kejriwal added he would come to dinner with two other AAP leaders at 8 pm.

247.title: This is new for me: Brendan on receiving award at Toronto Film Festival
247.article_body: Actor Brendan Fraser teared up after receiving the TIFF Tribute award for his performance in 'The Whale'. "This is new for me. I am normally the guy at the podium who hands these things out, I got pretty good at it," he stated. Earlier, Brendan received a standing ovation at the Venice International Film Festival for 'The Whale'.

248.title: Take down picture immediately: Patra on Congress' burning khaki shorts post
248.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and asked the party to take down the burning khaki shorts post immediately from social media. "It's not 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' but 'Bharat Todo' and 'Aag Lagao Yatra'...I want to ask Rahul Gandhi if he wants violence in this country. Congress should take down the picture immediately," said Patra.

249.title: B'luru civic body launches Wonder on Wheels for Anganwadi children
249.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Monday launched the 'Wonder on Wheels' initiative to introduce art and cultural activities for Anganwadi children in the city. The bus will travel across Bengaluru and stop by Anganwadis. Children will be engaged for one hour in activities related to theatre, music, art and culture.

250.title: Take steps to curb the spread of lumpy skin disease: Shinde to officials
250.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde asked the state's Animal Husbandry Department officials to be on alert and take steps to curb the spread of lumpy skin disease. He also instructed officials to run an awareness campaign to fight the disease. Earlier last week, the government had declared the state as a "controlled area" to curb the spread of the skin disease.

251.title: King Charles exempted from paying inheritance tax on Queen Elizabeth's personal assets
251.article_body: Queen Elizabeth is estimated to have left behind over $500 million in personal assets from her 70 years on the throne. While the bulk of the late Queen's personal wealth will pass to King Charles, he won’t be required to pay any inheritance tax as a rule introduced by the UK government in 1993, exempts sovereign-to-sovereign bequests from inheritance tax.

252.title: Kriti Sanon starts to prepare for Anurag Kashyap's next film: Reports
252.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has reportedly started preparing for director Anurag Kashyap's upcoming action drama. As per reports, she is undergoing acting workshops and language coaching for the film, which is her first project with Kashyap. "It's an extremely emotional film and the vengeance unleashed by Kriti's character is like never seen before on screen," the reports stated.

253.title: 6 girls escape from hostel in Mumbai by breaking window, locking guard
253.article_body: Six minor girls escaped from the Government Girls Hostel located in Mumbai's Govandi area by allegedly breaking cement window of the toilet and bending the iron grill fixed outside it. The minor girls reportedly locked the gate of the guard's room from outside before fleeing so they don't get followed. The police have been able to identify all the girls.

254.title: 16 women employees faint after spraying of mosquito repellent in Greater Noida firm
254.article_body: At least 16 women employees working in an electronic parts manufacturing company in Greater Noida fell unconscious after a mosquito repellent was sprayed in the company. The management later admitted the unconscious women to a private hospital. The relatives of the women, who reached the hospital, created a ruckus and filed a complaint, accusing the company's management of the incident.

255.title: Haryana women's panel head asks policewoman to get out during meet, video viral
255.article_body: The chairperson of Haryana State Commission for Women, Renu Bhatia, asked a woman police officer to "get out" of a room during a discussion over a marital dispute case, reports said. A video of the incident has gone viral. Bhatia is seen asking the woman police officer, "You could have slapped him (man)...You got the girl checked (medically) thrice."

256.title: No preconditions for mending ties with Saudi Arabia: Iran
256.article_body: Iran has no prerequisites in its talks with Saudi Arabia for normalisation of ties between the two countries, the Iranian Foreign Ministry said on Sunday. "Iran will respond proportionately to any constructive action by Saudi Arabia," the ministry's spokesperson said. Saudi Arabia severed diplomatic relations with Iran in 2016 after a violent mob broke into the Saudi embassy in Tehran.

257.title: Russian and French Presidents hold talks on security at Zaporizhzhia
257.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and French President Emmanuel Macron held talks over the safety issue at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. Putin blamed Ukrainian forces for the shelling while Macron pointed finger at Russian troops. Russia called for a "non-politicised interaction" with UN nuclear watchdog IAEA's participation. France said Russian troops were putting the plant at risk.

258.title: Good toss to lose boys: Jayawardena after SL's win over Pak in Asia Cup final
258.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said it was a "good toss to lose" after the Dasun Shanaka-led side defeated Pakistan while batting first in the Asia Cup 2022 final. Prior to the final, Sri Lanka had won matches in the tournament in which they won the toss and fielded first. Sri Lanka defended their 170/6 and won by 23 runs.

259.title: Iran to release 2 seized Greek tankers' crew: Greek seafarers union
259.article_body: The Greek union of commercial ships' seafarers has said that Iran has agreed to release the crew of two Greek tankers that were seized by it in May. Iran had seized the tankers after the US confiscated Iranian oil from a tanker, due to sanctions, held off the Greek coast. The union said that the crew would be replaced.

260.title: Neeraj Kabi to portray Jawaharlal Nehru in Vicky's 'Sam Bahadur': Report
260.article_body: Actor Neeraj Kabi has reportedly been roped in to portray India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru in 'Sam Bahadur', an upcoming film starring Vicky Kaushal, Sanya Malhotra and Fatima Sana Shaikh. Vicky will play the role of Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw in the movie. While Sanya will essay the role of Manekshaw's wife Silloo, Fatima will portray former PM Indira Gandhi.

261.title: Parts of Pune recorded 60 mm rainfall in 2 hours on Sunday: Report
261.article_body: Pune city witnessed heavy rainfall along with thunder and lightning on Sunday. In less than two hours, many areas in the city, including Wanowrie and Magarpatta, reportedly saw over 60 mm of rainfall. The city reported waterlogging in 25 areas and two incidents of wall collapse from Bavdhan and Warje. Uprooting of 10 trees was also reported in some places.

262.title: Warner is a tactical captain, someone guys love playing under: Finch
262.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has suggested that David Warner could be their next ODI captain. "Warner is an unbelievable tactical captain and someone who at the time the guys loved playing under," stated Finch. Notably, Warner was banned from leadership roles over his involvement in the 2018 sandpaper scandal. "I think (Cricket Australia) is revisiting that," added Finch.

263.title: BJP is worried as public is going to repeat Cong in Rajasthan: CM Gehlot
263.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that "BJP leaders are worried because the mood of the public is to repeat" the Congress government in the state. "There are excellent schemes in Rajasthan including [the] Chiranjeevi health insurance scheme...BJP leaders are working on a theory that if a lie is spoken 100 times, then it will appear as truth," CM Gehlot said.

264.title: No republic plan for New Zealand after Queen's death: PM Ardern
264.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said her government is not considering changing the country to a republic after the death of Queen Elizabeth II. Ardern said she thought New Zealand would probably become a republic during her lifetime but there were more pressing issues. Earlier, Ardern expressed her support for New Zealand to eventually become a republic.

265.title: Sachin Shroff replaces Shailesh Lodha in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'
265.article_body: Actor Sachin Shroff has replaced Shailesh Lodha to play the titular role in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "We had tried a lot to find a middle ground but [Shailesh] left the show...We've a team of good writers and direction...so hopefully people will accept Sachin in the role of Taarak Mehta," the show's producer Asit Kumarr Modi told Aaj Tak.

266.title: Went to washroom, media said I was unhappy: Ajit on leaving during NCP meet
266.article_body: While talking about reports of him leaving the stage during the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) meet in Delhi, party leader Ajit Pawar said that he had just gone to the washroom. "It was presented in the media as if I am unhappy," Pawar said, adding, "Should I give it in writing on a stamp paper that I am not unhappy?"

267.title: I'm super grateful to Ekta Kapoor: Pratik Sehajpal on bagging Naagin 6
267.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Pratik Sehajpal penned a note on Instagram thanking producer Ekta Kapoor for giving him his first-ever television show 'Naagin 6'. Calling himself "an outsider with no industry background", he said that he is "genuinely super grateful" to Ekta. "God bless you infinitely...Thank you for everything!" Pratik further wrote.

268.title: 12-yr-old girl raped in farmhouse near Pune, 22-yr-old man arrested
268.article_body: A 12-year-old girl living in employee quarters at a farmhouse located near Pune was allegedly raped by his 22-year-old neighbour. The man is related to the family of the girl and has been arrested. The girl was alone at her home when the man raped her and threatened to harm her family members if she informed anyone, police said.

269.title: Subject, content of Akshay Kumar's recent films were wrong: Theatre owner
269.article_body: Manoj Desai, executive director of Gaiety Galaxy and Maratha Mandir Cinema, opened up about actor Akshay Kumar's recent films failing at the box office. "Content galat, subject galat (Wrong content, wrong subject)," Desai stated. He added that people were not satisfied with the content of 'Raksha Bandhan'. Akshay's 'Prithviraj', 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Raksha Bandhan' failed to perform this year.

270.title: Krejcikova-Siniakova win US Open title, complete career Golden Slam
270.article_body: Czech duo of Katerina Siniakova and Barbora Krejcikova defeated all-American duo of Caty McNally and Taylor Townsend 3-6, 7-5, 6-1 to win their third Grand Slam doubles title of the year at US Open 2022 on Sunday. With this, the Tokyo Olympics gold medallists completed their career Golden Slam. Overall, it was the Czech pair's sixth Grand Slam title together.

271.title: SEBI seeks startup valuation details from PE and VC funds: Report
271.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI), on September 6, sent a communication to private equity (PE) and venture capitalist (VC) firms to check how they value the startups they support, the Economic Times reported. The SEBI asked firms to disclose qualifications of valuation agent. Investor complaints on opaque accounting practices may have triggered communication, the report said.

272.title: Tom Hanks is the greatest living actor: 'Pinocchio' director
272.article_body: 'Pinocchio' director Robert Zemeckis called Tom Hanks "the greatest living actor in the movie business". He said he enjoyed watching Tom bring his character of Geppetto to life. He said Tom's portrayal of the role was "spot on, wonderful and very warm". "Tom can do anything. He brought more to the role than I ever could have imagined," he added.

273.title: Illegal call centre busted by Gurugram Police; 4 arrested
273.article_body: Four people, including a woman, were arrested by the Gurugram Police for being involved in a loan app fraud racket. The suspects had set up an illegal call centre to extort money from victims and used to threaten them to reveal their liabilities, police said. The suspects were identified as Deepak, Sakshi Mehta, Ankit Kumar and Divyansh Kumar.

274.title: Yohani makes B'wood debut, sings 'Manike Mage Hithe' for 'Thank God'
274.article_body: Music composer Tanishk Bagchi has launched Sri Lankan singer Yohani of 'Manike Mage Hithe' fame in Bollywood with Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God'. She has sung the song in Hindi for the film, which also stars Sidharth Malhotra. "We knew this song, so we decided to use it. Bringing it into a Bollywood film would also help [Yohani]," Tanishk said.

275.title: Arjun Kapoor, Bhumi head to London for Mudassar Aziz film: Reports
275.article_body: Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar have left for London to reportedly start shooting for Mudassar Aziz's untitled directorial, which is said to be a comedy film. As per reports, the team will shoot for a month in London. Reportedly, after shooting a portion of the film with Arjun and Bhumi, the makers will finalise the film's second female lead.

276.title: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro to attend Queen's funeral
276.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has accepted an invitation to attend the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II, the country's foreign ministry said. The ministry told Reuters that Bolsonaro will travel to London on September 19. Other world leaders who are expected to attend the funeral include US President Joe Biden, UK Prime Minister Liz Truss and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

277.title: Which 7 Bollywood movies have entered ₹100-crore club in 3 days?
277.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra' has become the seventh Bollywood movie to earn ₹100 crore in three days of its release, collecting around ₹105 crore in the opening weekend. Other Bollywood movies to do so are 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' (₹101.5 crore), 'Sultan' (₹105.6 crore), 'Dangal' (₹104.6 crore), 'Tiger Zinda Hai' (₹115 crore), 'Race 3' (₹100.75 crore) and 'Sanju' (₹119.35 crore).

278.title: Won't collect wet garbage from societies with over 100 kg waste: PCMC
278.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has said that it will not collect wet garbage from housing societies that generate more than 100 kg of waste daily from October 2. The housing societies will have to dispose of their bulk wet waste on their own. The civic body collects more than 850 metric tonnes of garbage every day.

279.title: Woman seen punching dog, slamming it on road 5 times in Agra; incident caught on CCTV
279.article_body: Agra Police has launched an investigation after a CCTV footage showing a woman beating up a dog was widely circulated online. She can be seen slamming the dog on the ground five times after holding it by its leash. The dog is said to be in critical condition after the incident, according to reports.

280.title: Noida woman who slapped society guard arrested, later gets bail
280.article_body: A woman was arrested and then later granted bail after she was caught on video repeatedly slapping a security guard of a housing society in Noida, police said. "According to what we've learnt, [the woman] was angry because the guard didn't open the gate quick enough when she was entering...colony," an SHO said. The woman is reportedly a professor.

281.title: Often struggle finding my footing in Bollywood: Sayani Gupta
281.article_body: Actress Sayani Gupta said she "often struggles finding" her footing in Bollywood, and in such times, she looks up to her brother Probir Gupta as an inspiration. "My brother is a stalwart in the art world and he's one of the biggest reasons I do what I do," she said as she shared some of his latest work on Instagram.

282.title: 100% of animals will be vaccinated against brucellosis by 2025: PM Modi
282.article_body: Talking about problems related to lumpy skin disease, PM Narendra Modi assured that 100 per cent of animals would be vaccinated against Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD) and brucellosis in the country by 2025. "Our scientists have prepared an indigenous vaccine for lumpy skin disease. We are also emphasising on universal vaccination of animals," said the PM.

283.title: Footwear collected during immersion procession fills 6 tempos: PMC
283.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has said that footwear collected by its Solid Waste Management Department during the last day of the Ganpati immersion procession on September 9 filled six tempos. The department also collected 33 tonnes of garbage, including 21 tonnes of nirmalya (floral offerings to Ganpati). Around 0.5 million people took part in the procession on Friday and Saturday.

284.title: Israeli PM Lapid visits Germany to hold talks on Iran nuclear deal
284.article_body: Israeli PM Yair Lapid will meet German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, President Frank-Walter Steinmeier and Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock in Berlin. Lapid aims to persuade Western powers to stop trying to revive Iran nuclear deal. Before arriving in Berlin, Lapid thanked the UK, France and Germany for their "strong position" as they raised concerns over Iran's commitment to revive the deal.

285.title: A list we mustn't be left out of: Mahindra on 'top 10 most educated countries' list
285.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Monday reacted to a list shared on Twitter which showed the 'top 10 most educated countries' in the world. "This is a list we must not be left out of," Mahindra tweeted, as India was not included in the list. He further wrote, "It's not just the government's task. We all have to do our bit."

286.title: Antigua and Barbuda to hold referendum for Republic as Charles becomes King
286.article_body: Antigua and Barbuda plans to hold a referendum on becoming a Republic in a move that could see King Charles III removed as the head of state. "This is a matter that has to be taken to a referendum...within the next, probably, three years," PM Gaston Browne said after Charles was confirmed as the country's King following Queen Elizabeth's death.

287.title: SC dismisses man's plea to exhume body of son killed in J&K encounter
287.article_body: Supreme Court dismissed the plea of a man to hand over the body of his son Amir Latief Magrey who was killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Hyderpora. Administration submitted that the deceased was buried in compliance with Islamic last rites. Court allowed the family to offer prayers at the grave and directed state to comply compensation order.

288.title: UP court rules in favour of Hindu women’s petition in Gyanvapi mosque case
288.article_body: Varanasi District and Sessions Court has dismissed the challenge by Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee against the maintainability of civil suits challenging the title of the Gyanvapi mosque and the land surrounding it. Five Hindu women had filed petitions seeking the right to worship Maa Shringar Gauri on the outer wall of the mosque complex located next to Kashi Vishwanath temple.

289.title: 3 villas lying vacant due to floods in B'luru looted; jewellery stolen
289.article_body: Thieves looted diamond, gold and silver jewellery from three villas in Bengaluru's Rainbow Drive layout after their residents had moved out due to flooding in the city. Residents realised they'd been looted when they returned to their homes to asses the flooding situation. One of the residents reportedly lost five pieces of diamond jewellery and 22 pieces of gold jewellery.

290.title: St Stephen's can't conduct interviews for non-Christians: Delhi HC
290.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday said that admission of students from non-minority communities for undergraduate courses at St Stephen's College will take place completely on the basis of Common University Entrance Test (CUET) score. The court further ruled that no interviews would be conducted for admissions of non-Christian students and ordered the college to withdraw the admission prospectus.

291.title: Women real leaders of India's dairy sector, represent 70% of workforce: PM
291.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has stated that women are the real leaders of India's dairy sector, adding that they represent 70% of the workforce. He was speaking at the inauguration of the International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit 2022. "In 2014, India produced 146 million tonnes of milk. Now it has increased to 210 million tonnes," he said.

292.title: Stray fireworks explode at festival in Mexico; 1 dead, 39 injured
292.article_body: One person died and 39 others were injured after stray fireworks exploded during a town festival in Mexico's Tianguistenco. The municipal government said that of those injured, five were in serious condition and seven are still hospitalised. A video of the incident purportedly shows a firework-laden "torito", a wood or wire framework, running through the crowd, The Associated Press reported.

293.title: I would've bowled out Haris after SL lost 5 wickets: Latif on Babar's captaincy
293.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif has questioned Babar Azam's captaincy against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup 2022 final, stating that he would've kept attacking using Haris Rauf's overs after Sri Lanka lost five wickets for 58 runs. "Instead, Babar bowled part-time spinner. That surprised me...No wickets fell [till the 15th over] and run-rate also kept climbing," added Latif.

294.title: Didn't receive masala dosa parcel sent by Congress: Tejasvi Surya
294.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised Congress and claimed that he did not receive the masala dosa parcel that was sent by the Congress. Earlier on Saturday, the Congress workers said that they were sending 10 different dosas from popular restaurants to Surya. This comes after he was seen reviewing masala dosa when people of Bengaluru were affected by the floods.

295.title: Ganesh laddu auctioned for ₹60.8 lakh through crowdfunding in Hyd
295.article_body: A Ganesh laddu weighing five kilograms was auctioned for ₹60.8 lakh through a crowdfunding initiative in Keerthi Richmond Villas in Hyderabad's Sun City. A Keerthi Richmond Villas trustee said that the auction was part of an annual fundraiser by RV DIYA Charitable Trust for the benefit of maids, drivers, gardeners and labourers around the gated community, Times of India reported.

296.title: Couple celebrating 60th anniversary opened card signed by Queen Elizabeth the day she died
296.article_body: An elderly couple from UK opened a hand-signed card from Queen Elizabeth II, congratulating them on their 60th wedding anniversary, on the day she died. The couple received the card on September 7 but waited until the next day to open it on their anniversary. The couple learned of the Queen's illness while they were out on a celebratory lunch.

297.title: GHMC to create advertising space near transformers to generate revenue
297.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) plans to enhance the vicinity of 1,000 transformers in each of the six zones of the city and then allow private agencies to give it as advertisement space. "We are inviting proposals from private players for the enhancement of the area surrounding the transformers," a GHMC official told The New Indian Express.

298.title: IMD issues orange alert for 2 days amid heavy rainfall in Pune
298.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Pune and adjoining areas on Sunday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall in Ghat areas over the next two days, an official said. Meanwhile, several incidents of trees falling were reported from Pune and adjoining areas.

299.title: Video shows Punjab woman struggling to stand on road due to 'drugs'; probe launched
299.article_body: Police in Punjab's Amritsar launched an investigation after a video of a woman struggling to stand on road allegedly under influence of drugs surfaced online. "A video showing a girl under the influence of drugs went viral yesterday. However, no drug or syringe was found with her...Amritsar Police conducted a search operation and took 15 suspects into custody," police said.

300.title: 19-year-old beaten to death for stealing mobile phone in Delhi
300.article_body: A group of factory workers allegedly killed a 19-year-old by beating him with belts and plastic pipes after catching him stealing a mobile phone in Delhi. The victim's hair was also chopped off by the main accused to teach him a lesson, police said. His body was found lying on a road in Shahzada Bagh with chopped hair strewn around.

301.title: Ahmedabad Police deny conducting raids at Aam Aadmi Party's district office
301.article_body: Ahmedabad Police took to Twitter to say no raids were carried out at the district office of the Aam Aadmi Party. This comes after Gujarat AAP leader Isudan Gadhvi said that raids were carried out at the office. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal also reacted to it and said that BJP is "extremely rattled" by support AAP is getting in Gujarat.

302.title: Delhi Metro's Yellow line affected for 3 hours over technical snag
302.article_body: The Yellow line of Delhi Metro, which connects Huda City Centre to Samaypur Badli, was affected for roughly three hours over technical snag on Monday. The entry gate of MG Road station was also suspended temporarily but the exit was operational. DMRC (Delhi Metro Rail Corporation) carried out pre-planned maintenance work between Sultanpur and Qutab Minar metro stations on Sunday.

303.title: Video shows doctor abandoning car in Bengaluru traffic & running 3 km to perform surgery
303.article_body: A video showing a gastroenterology surgeon, Dr Govind Nandakumar, running to a hospital in Bengaluru to perform an emergency surgery after his car got stuck in the traffic has gone viral online. According to reports, Dr Nandakumar ran for three kilometres and later performed a successful laparoscopic gallbladder surgery on a woman patient. The incident took place on August 30.

304.title: Nitish Kumar and Lalu Yadav will be meeting Sonia Gandhi soon: Tejashwi
304.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav confirmed that CM Nitish Kumar and RJD supremo Lalu Yadav will be meeting UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi in the backdrop of Opposition’s attempts at forging an alliance against the BJP. Bihar CM was recently seen meeting Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav during his visit to Delhi.

305.title: Man poses as London surgeon, cheats woman of ₹8.2 lakh for Rakhi gift
305.article_body: A Mumbai woman has been cheated out of over ₹8.2 lakh after a fraudster posing as a surgeon from London promised her a gift for Rakshabandhan. The two met on Instagram and began chatting as brother and sister when the man promised her a gift. The accused asked her to pay customs clearance, conveyance charges and insurance on separate occasions.

306.title: We're for it: Sri Lanka Prez on Bill to decriminalise homosexuality
306.article_body: Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Sunday said that the country's government will not oppose a Private Member's Bill to decriminalise homosexuality, the Colombo Gazette reported. "We are for it, but you have to get the support of individual members. It's a matter of their private conscience," he said. The Bill was handed over to Wickremesinghe in August.

307.title: WazirX says bank accounts worth ₹65 crore frozen by ED released after probe
307.article_body: WazirX said on Monday that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has released bank accounts frozen as part of its investigation into money laundering. The crypto exchange platform said it can now resume banking operations after over a month. In August, the ED had frozen WazirX's bank assets worth ₹64.67 crore for "assisting accused instant loan app companies in laundering fraud money".

308.title: Boys damaged Marine Lines foot overbridge: BMC's bridge dept to vigilance
308.article_body: The vigilance department under the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) conducted a probe to check the recently-built Marine Lines foot overbridge after receiving several complaints from commuters and found broken and popped-up tiles in the bridge. However, the bridge department refuted the allegations by vigilance and claimed that boys might have broken the tiles with cricket bats.

309.title: I am devastated that my time at Chelsea has come to an end: Thomas Tuchel
309.article_body: Thomas Tuchel has said he's devastated that his time at Chelsea as manager came to an end last week. "This is one of the most difficult statements I have ever had to write...This is a club where I felt at home, both professionally and personally," wrote Tuchel on Twitter. Graham Potter has been named as the new manager.

310.title: Bengaluru action plan committee formed to revive its lost glory: Congress
310.article_body: Owing to the recent flooding incidents in Bengaluru, the Congress has formed a committee to restore the city's lost glory. "Under the chairmanship of Ramalinga Reddy, I have formed an action plan committee. We will formulate a plan based on the committee's report that will help in reclaiming Namma Bengaluru's lost glory," said Congress leader DK Shivakumar.

311.title: Biden to widen curbs on exporting US chips, tools to China: Report
311.article_body: The Biden administration plans to widen curbs on shipment of US-made semiconductors to China used for artificial intelligence and chipmaking tools, sources told Reuters. The Commerce Department is looking to publish new rules communicated to three US firms in letters written earlier this year. The letters barred the firms from exporting chipmaking equipment to Chinese factories without licences.

312.title: Sonali Phogat's death to be probed by CBI: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
312.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said that his government will hand over the case pertaining to the death of Haryana BJP leader and actor Sonali Phogat to the CBI. "We have full faith in our police but people have repeatedly demanded and her daughter has also demanded that the case be handled by the CBI," he said.

313.title: Have seen ‘Vikram Vedha’, actors did tremendous job: Rakesh Roshan
313.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said he watched 'Vikram Vedha' and found the script was "intelligently presented" by Pushkar-Gayatri. He said the filmmakers presented the plot in a novel way and the actors "have done a tremendous job". 'Vikram Vedha', which is the Hindi remake of the Tamil film with the same name, stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan as leads.

314.title: PM Modi likely to flag off Vande Bharat Express on 30th September
314.article_body: PM Modi is likely to flag off Vande Bharat Express from Gandhinagar on 30th September. The train conducted successful trial between Ahmedabad and Mumbai on Friday. "Railway is planning to start Vande Bharat Express between two financial hubs of the country from 30th September, however, final decision will be taken after confirmation from the PMO," said a source.

315.title: Ukraine says Russia attacking civilian infrastructure in retaliation
315.article_body: Ukraine accused Russia of targeting civilian infrastructure after its troops launched an offensive to drive out Russian forces from Kharkiv. According to Ukrainian officials, water facilities and a thermal power station were attacked in Kharkiv which led to widespread blackouts. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said winter could see further territorial gains if Kyiv received more powerful weapons.

316.title: World's largest shipping firm reroutes fleet to avoid clashes with Sri Lankan blue whales
316.article_body: The world's largest shipping and logistics company, MSC Group, has rerouted its ships passing near the coast of Sri Lanka in order to avoid potential collisions with endangered blue whales. MSC said that the action came in response to research conducted by the International Fund for Animal Welfare along with other organisations. MSC's voluntary rerouting doesn't impact other shipping carriers.

317.title: Harry Styles wins his first acting honour at Toronto Film Fest
317.article_body: Singer-actor Harry Styles, who attended the Toronto Film Festival 2022 with his 'My Policeman' co-stars Emma Corrin and David Dawson, won his first acting award at the festival's Tribute Awards. The cast of 'My Policeman' received the ensemble award on Sunday night. Thanking the audience for the award, Harry said he and his cast members loved working on the film.

318.title: Prashant Kishor is a businessman: JD(U) National President Lalan Singh
318.article_body: JD(U) National President Lalan Singh criticised political strategist Prashant Kishor and called him a businessman. “Has PK ever seen Bihar? PK embodies different roles. Right now PK is working for the BJP. The education system has improved so much and so much work has been done for the girls...We all know whose work they are doing,” said Singh.

319.title: Offer is still open: Gulshan on starring with Kartik in 'Aashiqui 3'
319.article_body: Gulshan Devaiah had recently expressed his will to be Kartik Aaryan's "leading lady" in 'Aashiqui 3'. He said that while the tweet was a joke, the "offer is still open" and he will "definitely consider" playing the part as it will be a "tough thing to pull off". "If I pull it off convincingly, it will be awesome," he said.

320.title: Germany calls for more support for Ukraine's counteroffensive
320.article_body: German politicians have called for active promotion of counteroffensive in Ukraine with new weapons after its troops succeeded in driving Russian forces out of some parts of the country. Michael Roth from Social Democratic Party of Germany said it seems realistic "that Ukraine can win this war...as a...democratic country". Germany supplied heavy weapons to Ukraine like Panzerhaubitze 2000.

321.title: Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya & her husband Vishagan welcome baby boy
321.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya Rajinikanth and her husband Vishagan welcomed a baby boy on Sunday. "With God's abundant grace and our parents' blessings, Vishagan, Ved and I are thrilled to welcome Ved's little brother Veer Rajinikanth Vanangamudi," Soundarya tweeted. She also shared pictures from her pregnancy shoot on Twitter.

322.title: PM Modi inaugurates World Dairy Summit in Greater Noida
322.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit 2022 in Greater Noida today. Around 1,500 participants from 50 countries are expected to participate in the four-day summit being organised at India Expo Centre and Mart. "India is building the largest database of dairy animals," PM Modi said during the inauguration ceremony.

323.title: Sonu Sood announces free online IAS coaching program
323.article_body: Actor and philanthropist Sonu Sood's Sood Charity Foundation, in collaboration with Divine India Youth Association (DIYA), announced the launch of free online IAS coaching program, called Sambhavam, for the year 2022-23. "The goal is to provide equal opportunities to IAS aspirants from all economic backgrounds and empower them with knowledge. Knowledge is power after all," Sonu said.

324.title: We’re living in times when language is no more a barrier: Ranveer
324.article_body: At the recently held South Indian International Movie Awards (SIIMA) 2022, Ranveer Singh hailed India's diversity and expressed how language is no more a barrier. The actor said he's grateful that people are rising above subtitles and are accepting "stories from different languages and cultures". Ranveer won the Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India at the event.

325.title: Jacqueline's questioning in Sukesh case postponed over prior commitments
325.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez, who was summoned by Delhi Police for questioning in connection with the conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar case, asked to skip the summons over "prior work commitments". Her request has been granted and Delhi Police will be issuing fresh summons to the actress at a later date. Jacqueline was earlier questioned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED).

326.title: SL Navy detains 85 people trying to illegally migrate by boat
326.article_body: Sri Lanka Navy has detained 85 people who were allegedly attempting to illegally migrate to a foreign country by a boat in the eastern waters on Sunday, local media reported. The detained people include 60 men, 14 women and 11 children. Five suspects linked to the illegal migration attempt were also arrested following a search operation at a beach.

327.title: Jaishankar meets Saudi Crown Prince, gives him PM Modi's written message
327.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah on Sunday and handed over a written message from PM Narendra Modi. Jaishankar arrived in Saudi Arabia on Saturday on a three-day visit to discuss ways to further strengthen relations between the two countries. It is his first visit to Saudi Arabia as External Affairs Minister.

328.title: This is the best feeling: Ranbir on success of 'Brahmastra'
328.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, along with director Ayan Mukerji, visited a theatre in Mumbai to witness the audience's reaction to 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva'. As the duo greeted fans after the show, Ranbir expressed how it's been "the best feeling" to watch the audience being entertained and emotional during the film. Ranbir said he is "extremely happy and proud" of Ayan.

329.title: Khap Mahapanchayat seeks CBI probe in Phogat's death, threatens mass agitation
329.article_body: A Haryana Khap Mahapanchayat held in Jat Dharamshala has asked the state government to recommend a CBI probe in actress-BJP leader Sonali Phogat's death case by September 23. The Mahapanchayat has threatened to launch a mass agitation if the CBI probe is not recommended. Phogat's daughter Yashodhara was also a part of the meeting held on Sunday.

330.title: Electric mobility startup Yulu raises $82 million in funding
330.article_body: Electric mobility startup Yulu has raised $82 million in a Series B funding round led by Canada-based mobility technology firm Magna International. Existing investors, including Bajaj Auto, also participated in the current round. The startup was founded in 2017 by Amit Gupta, RK Misra, Naveen Dachuri and Hemant Gupta, three of whom graduated from IIT Kanpur.

331.title: Govt is result of organisation's hard work, it's bigger than govt: UP BJP chief
331.article_body: UP BJP chief Bhupendra Singh Chaudhary said government is a result of organisation's hard work, hence organisation is bigger than government. "There is no question about it," Chaudhary added. "When public gave us the opportunity, we worked to fulfil that agenda decided by the party. The government is taking ahead that agenda of the party," he stated.

332.title: Pune faces power cuts after heavy rain, bikes float on waterlogged road; video surfaces
332.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Pune on Sunday, flooding streets and causing power cuts in several areas, reports said. A Twitter user shared a video of bikes floating in water on a waterlogged road. Parts of Pune received 50 mm rain in nearly an hour on Sunday evening. Several instances of trees falling were also reported in the city and adjoining areas.

333.title: Prince William sent last-minute text to Harry inviting him & Meghan to Windsor: Report
333.article_body: Prince William reportedly sent a last-minute text to Prince Harry inviting him with his wife Meghan Markle to Windsor Castle to pay tributes to the late Queen Elizabeth. According to a royal source, "The Prince of Wales thought it was an important show of unity at a...difficult time." Their walkabout was delayed by 45 minutes as they discussed their plans.

334.title: Easy to comment from outside: Coach Saqlain on criticism of Rizwan's batting
334.article_body: Reacting to former cricketers', including Shoaib Akhtar's, criticism of Muhammad Rizwan's batting in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka, Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said, "Easy to comment from outside, one gets to know only when they are part of the team." Shoaib had tweeted, "Rizwan, 50 off 50 is not going to work anymore. Doesn't benefit Pakistan."

335.title: Rachakonda police rescue motorist who fell into flowing water
335.article_body: Rachakonda Traffic Police has saved the life of a 30-year-old man who slipped and fell with his bike into flowing water at Kolanupaka Culvert causeway with the help of L&O police and villagers, police said. The police also shared a video of the incident on Twitter. Rachakonda CP Mahesh Bhagwat has also announced a reward for the traffic police.

336.title: BMC to start door-to-door BP, diabetes screening of people above 30 years
336.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation will conduct a door-to-door screening of people above 30 years for blood pressure and diabetes in order to identify and treat the conditions early. Additional Municipal Commissioner Dr Sanjeev Kumar said that 68% of people aged between 18-69 years die of non-communicable diseases like heart attacks, kidney diseases, strokes and cardiovascular complications.

337.title: Delhi Police uses Pak cricketers' clip from Asia Cup in road safety tweet
337.article_body: Delhi Police has used a clip of Pakistani cricketers Asif Ali and Shadab Khan bumping into each other while trying to take a catch in the Asia Cup final for a road safety tweet. The clip had the song 'Aye Bhai Zara Dekh Ke Chalo' playing in the background. Both fielders dropped the catch in the match against Sri Lanka.

338.title: Multiple layers of protection keeps your privacy protected: WhatsApp
338.article_body: WhatsApp introduces new built-in privacy features of protection like online presence, leave groups silently, screenshot blocking for view once. These multiple new features along with existing features like end-to-end encryption, two-step verification, and encrypted backups come together to offer users more control over their privacy needs, said the brand.

339.title: Mysterious sea creature like 'blue goo' found in Caribbean; pic goes viral
339.article_body: A mysterious sea creature, which the scientists referred to as 'blue goo', was found on the floor of the Caribbean Sea by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Okeanos Explorer crew. "Seen multiple times during off St Croix, this "blue goo" animal stumped scientists, who thought it might be soft coral, sponge, or tunicate," the crew tweeted.

340.title: Was following official orders: Principal on video of students cleaning toilets
340.article_body: The Ballia primary school principal, who was suspended over purportedly making students clean school toilets, has said that he was only following official orders. He said it was part of a cleanliness drive by teachers and students for the Swachhata Pakhwada programme. "I received an order from the Block Education Officer...I also cleaned toilets with the students," he added.

341.title: Tesla sees three more executives depart months after India plan put on hold: Report
341.article_body: Tesla has seen three of its executives from the original 12-member India team depart in the last three months, Economic Times reported. The exits come after its Policy and Business Development executive Manuj Khurana resigned in June. While earlier reports said Tesla has put its India plan on hold, the company is yet to to give up its Bengaluru office.

342.title: 'Secret' letter by Queen Elizabeth locked in Australia vault, can't be opened till 2085
342.article_body: A 'secret' letter written by Queen Elizabeth II in 1986 is locked inside a vault in a historic building in Australia, reports said. Addressed to the Lord Mayor of Sydney, an instruction reads, "On a suitable day...in the year 2085 AD, would you please open this envelope and convey to the citizens of Sydney my message to them."

343.title: Heavy rains lash parts of Pune, water enters houses; video surfaces
343.article_body: Several areas in Pune were waterlogged after heavy rainfall lashed the city on Saturday. Several roads, including the one outside the Pune Fire Brigade office on BT Kavade road, were submerged in water and rainwater also entered the houses of some people in the Kothrud area of Pune. The city received 70 mm of rainfall until 6:45 pm on Saturday.

344.title: Lucknow minor who staged his own kidnapping recovered from Delhi
344.article_body: A 15-year-old boy from Lucknow who staged his own kidnapping has been recovered from Delhi, counselled and handed over to his parents. The boy had been angry with his family members over some issue and faked the kidnapping, police said. His phone was operational and he kept sending voice messages in his own voice but made no ransom calls.

345.title: Thousands protest against planned European LGBTQ event in Serbia
345.article_body: Thousands of religious and right-wing groups marched through Serbia's Belgrade in a protest against a European LGBTQ event which is scheduled to take place this week. The country's President Aleksandar Vucic had announced his decision to cancel the event in August, however, the event's organisers had said they will hold the event even if authorities cancel it.

346.title: Gautam Gambhir poses with Sri Lankan flag after Asia Cup final, shares video
346.article_body: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir took to social media to share a video of him posing with Sri Lankan flag after Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by 23 runs in the final in Dubai to win Asia Cup 2022. "Superstar team...Truly deserving!!" Gambhir wrote. Sri Lanka won the Asia Cup for the sixth time.

347.title: Gujarat AAP leader claims police raided party office in Ahmedabad
347.article_body: Gujarat AAP leader Isudan Gadhvi on Monday claimed that after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal arrived in Ahmedabad, the police raided the party's district office. Kejriwal reacted to the alleged raid by saying that BJP is "extremely rattled" by the support that AAP is getting in Gujarat. "Nothing was found in Delhi and nothing was found in Gujarat too," Kejriwal added.

348.title: Doctor examines woman under torch after long power cut in UP, video surfaces
348.article_body: A doctor in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia allegedly examined a woman under torch light after a long power cut. A video of the incident also surfaced online.
