A doctor said the hospital has a generator for power backup but it took time as batteries for the generator were being found. The batteries had been removed due to fear of being stolen.

349.title: Ex-Lido staff gets threat calls, texts from parents as firm files for bankruptcy
349.article_body: Several former sales executives at Lido Learning received calls, messages, and even threats from parents after the company filed for bankruptcy. One of the messages read, "We're...going to the police against you and your fraud company." In February, Lido asked over 1,200 employees to resign and most executives claim they’re yet to recover their own dues from the company.

350.title: Don't want to cash in on franchise's popularity: Anees on No Entry 2
350.article_body: Speaking about 'No Entry Mein Entry', filmmaker Anees Bazmee stated that he doesn't want to cash in on the popularity of the franchise by making something mediocre. The filmmaker further said that the film will continue from where the 2005 prequel 'No Entry' ended with Salman Khan, Fardeen Khan and Anil Kapoor. The film is expected to roll in January.

351.title: Carlos has sort of mixture of both Nadal and Djokovic: Casper Ruud
351.article_body: After losing to Spain's Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open final, Norway's 23-year-old Casper Ruud said Alcaraz has a "sort of mixture of both" Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic's qualities. "Alcaraz is fast, flexible. He can slide around. It's impressive...he's a hard nut to crack," added Ruud. Alcaraz won the final to become the youngest men's world number one.

352.title: Last ball 6 helped us with momentum & it's a game of momentum: SL's Bhanuka
352.article_body: Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa, who slammed 71*(45) against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 final, has said the last over of their innings helped them to get the momentum in the game. "This is a game of momentum," added Bhanuka. Sri Lanka scored 15 runs off the final over, with Bhanuka smashing a six off the final delivery.

353.title: 7 die, 3 injured as bus they were travelling in hits trailer in Chhattisgarh
353.article_body: Seven people were killed and three others were injured after the bus that they were travelling in rammed into a parked trailer near Madai Ghat in Korba district. News agency ANI reported that the incident took place around 4 am on Monday. Police officer Santosh Singh said that those injured have been admitted to a hospital.

354.title: Ramiz Raja asks 'Aap India se hain?', grabs Indian reporter's phone after Pak's defeat
354.article_body: After Pakistan lost the Asia Cup final, a video of PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja getting angry at an Indian journalist and grabbing his phone went viral. The video shows the journalist asking, "People are very sad. What message would you give them?" Getting angry at this, Raja said, "Aap India se honge? Aap to bade khush honge?"

355.title: Couldn't get night show tickets for 'Brahmāstra', watched morning show: Hansal
355.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta has said that he failed to get night show tickets for Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra', adding that he went to the "nearly 60-70%" full cinema hall for the morning show. "I really enjoyed #Brahmastra...And long queues for the later shows at the same multiplex. The 2nd part is going to be HUGE," the filmmaker tweeted.

356.title: Audience's love is the biggest 'Brahmāstra' for us: Ranbir Kapoor
356.article_body: Speaking about the success of his film 'Brahmāstra', actor Ranbir Kapoor said that the love they are receiving is the biggest 'Brahmāstra'. "People are laughing, clapping. This is what [cinema] is all about," the actor added. 'Brahmāstra' earned ₹75 crore on its opening day and ₹85 crore on the second day, making the film's total worldwide collection ₹160 crore.

357.title: I’m a Champion, but also a SleepyCat: Ruturaj Gaikwad in SleepyCat ad
357.article_body: SleepyCat announced that as India's highest-rated mattress brand, it has launched its latest campaign 'Champions Are Also SleepyCats', with cricket champions Ruturaj Gaikwad and Harleen Deol. The campaign films aim to show how they prioritise their rest along with their intense training regimens on their SleepyCat Ultima Mattress. It's India's first mattress with CoolTEC™ Fabric, SleepyCat added.

358.title: Violence erupts in MP Ganesha procession as woman asks to turn music off
358.article_body: Violence erupted in Madhya Pradesh's Udaipura over music being played during a Ganesha immersion procession. Police said that the incident took place when a woman belonging to another community reportedly objected to youths dancing in the procession and asked them to turn the music off. The woman allegedly also threw water on people from the roof of her house.

359.title: Tata Group makes offer to buy stake in Bisleri International: Report
359.article_body: The Tata Group has reportedly made an offer for a stake in India's largest packaged water company Bisleri International. A report, while citing an executive, stated that the stake would allow Tatas a "massive foothold in packaged drinking water" in various categories across different levels. Notably, Bisleri has more than 150 manufacturing plants with a network of over 4,000 distributors.

360.title: BEST to start premium bus service between Thane and BKC from Sept 26
360.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) will start its premium services between Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) and Thane from September 26. "The buses will operate during peak hours on office-going routes. The seats can be booked through the Chalo app and no standees will be allowed," a BEST official said. BEST has placed an order for procuring 200 buses.

361.title: India reports 5,221 new COVID-19 cases and 15 deaths, positivity rate at 2.82%
361.article_body: India has reported 5,221 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours and 15 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,076 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country stood at 47,176, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.82%.

362.title: PM Modi to visit Noida today, traffic police issues advisory
362.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Noida today to inaugurate International Dairy Federation World Dairy Summit which is being organised at India Expo Centre and Mart, Greater Noida. In view of the PM's visit, Noida Traffic Police issued an advisory for daily commuters to avoid disruption in movement. The police have placed various diversions on the Delhi-Greater Noida Expressway route.

363.title: Shadab Khan apologises after Pakistan lose Asia Cup final, says 'I take responsibility'
363.article_body: After his team lost Asia Cup 2022 final against Sri Lanka by 23 runs, Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan tweeted, "Catches win matches. Sorry...I take responsibility for this loss. I let my team down." Shadab dropped Bhanuka Rajapaksa in 18th over. He was also involved in a collision with Asif Ali, which led to another dropped catch in the 19th over.

364.title: Ups and downs will be there, but it'd be nicer if we make lesser mistakes: Babar
364.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said it would've been nicer had they made lesser mistakes against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup 2022 final. "In a final, the margin for mistakes is lesser. Our fielding wasn't up to the mark...the batting couldn't finish it off well," he added. Sri Lanka bundled out Pakistan for 147 to win by 23 runs.

365.title: Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is actually 'Gandhi family bachao yatra': BJP MLA
365.article_body: Assam BJP MLA Diganta Kalita said that Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is actually "Gandhi family bachao yatra". "Even after 75 years of independence...the Congress party did not think about others who can lead the party apart from the Gandhi family," Kalita added. "The Congress party has now become only Gandhi party and a circus party," he stated.

366.title: False: PVR CEO on report claiming 'Brahmastra' caused ₹800-crore loss to cinema chains
366.article_body: Reacting to a report which alleged that Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' caused theatre chains PVR and INOX cumulatively to lose over ₹800 crore in market capitalisation on the release day, PVR CEO Kamal Gianchandani called it "false and negative" information. He tweeted, "Is it a lack of understanding or is it intentionally designed to cast doubts?"

367.title: Pak's Shadab jokingly tries to raise umpire's finger during Asia Cup final, video viral
367.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan jokingly tried to raise umpire's finger after a DRS decision went against Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2022 final against Sri Lanka. During the sixth over of Sri Lanka's innings, Pakistan called for review after umpire signalled not out for an LBW appeal. The decision stood after DRS showed 'umpire's call' for ball hitting the wickets.

368.title: NIA raids 50 locations in North India linked to organised terror gangs: Report
368.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Monday raided about 50 locations in North India linked to organised terror gangs involved in narco-terrorism, arms smuggling, inter-gang rivalry and other illegal activities, Hindustan Times reported. The NIA conducted searches in Delhi-NCR, Haryana and Punjab in connection with suspected terror gangs linked to Sidhu Moosewala's killing, ANI reported.

369.title: Drugs entering India via Gujarat port, smuggled to Punjab: Kejriwal
369.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said drugs are entering India in large quantities through Gujarat port and are being smuggled to Punjab and other parts of the country from there. "Why is this happening? Apparently, somewhere the administration is involved at the top," he added. Kejriwal did not mention the name of any particular port.

370.title: Delhi kidney racket accused inspired by 3 idiots, thinks he's gifted: Police
370.article_body: Delhi Police have said that the main accused in a kidney transplantation racket in South Delhi is inspired by the movie '3 Idiots'. "[He] thinks he is a gifted surgeon...He said doctors were only hired to do the side work. All surgeries were performed by him and he has a 100% success rate," a police source said.

371.title: Reliance Infra files ₹13,400 crore claim in 2017 deal with Adani Transmission
371.article_body: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Infrastructure has filed an arbitration claim of ₹13,400 crore against Adani Transmission, citing "breach of terms" in a deal to sell its Mumbai power distribution business. "The financial implication cannot be ascertained and is contingent upon the final outcome of arbitration," the company said. Notably, Adani acquired Reliance's power business for ₹18,800 crore in 2017.

372.title: Delhi civic body asks people to register pets amid rise in dog-bite cases
372.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Sunday asked residents to get their pets registered due to an "increasing number" of dog-bite incidents. The civic body added that it's mandatory to do so under Section 399 of Delhi Municipal Corporation Act 1957 and that the MCD can detain a dog found in a public place if the registration isn't done.

373.title: Getting to 170 made the difference mentally, as 160 feels chasable: Dasun
373.article_body: Talking about their 23-run win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2022 final, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said getting to 170 runs made the difference "mentally", as 160 feels chasable. "Each and every individual did well for us and that is how we became champions," he added. Sri Lanka were 58/5 after 8.5 overs but ended up posting 170/6.

374.title: Water supply to be hit in parts of Delhi on Sept 13-14
374.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board said that parts of national capital will face water supply disruptions in the evening of September 13 and the morning of September 14. The water supply will be affected due to maintenance work in the area. The list of affected areas include - North East Delhi, Sonia Vihar, Karawal Nagar, Tahirpur, Dilshad Garden and Nand Nagri.

375.title: Woman, brother-in-law arrested for husband's murder in Hyderabad
375.article_body: A woman, her brother-in-law and three others were arrested for allegedly murdering her husband, who'd been missing since August, in Hyderabad. The woman and her brother-in-law were apparently in a relationship and had plotted to kill the deceased. Reportedly, the deceased was given a drink laced with sedatives, was choked to death and his body was dumped in a river.

376.title: Late Sonali Phogat's last film 'Prerna' will be released soon: Film makers
376.article_body: Late BJP leader and actress Sonali Phogat's last film titled 'Prerna' will be released soon, said the makers of the movie on Monday. Director/Producer Naresh Dhanda, who plays the role of the father-in-law in the film, said that 'Prerna' is a motivational film. Sonali Phogat's daughter Yashodhara released the movie's poster on Friday.

377.title: Gadkari shares Akshay Kumar's ad on 6-airbags, Twitter users say 'ad promotes dowry'
377.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari recently shared an ad on road safety and six airbags that featured actor Akshay Kumar. In the ad, Akshay taunts a father at a wedding for sending his daughter and son-in-law in a car with just two airbags. Commenting on it, Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi said that the ad promoted the "criminal act of dowry".

378.title: Teen killed boy in Nuh to evade studies, hoped it'd shut madarsa: Police
378.article_body: Days after a decomposed body of an 11-year-old boy was found in a mosque on the premises of a madrasa in Nuh, police have said that a teenager allegedly killed the victim as he did not want to study at the madrasa. The accused hoped that a "big incident" would lead to the madrasa being shut down.

379.title: How much prize money did US Open 2022 winners and runners-up get?
379.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz and Iga Świątek bagged a prize money of $2.6 million (over ₹20 crore) each for winning men's and women's singles titles, respectively at US Open 2022. Casper Ruud and Ons Jabeur, who finished runners-up in their respective categories, won $1.3 million (over ₹10 crore) each. Alcaraz won his maiden Grand Slam title, while Świątek won her third.

380.title: Mount Mary fair begins in Bandra; festival to be live-streamed
380.article_body: The Mount Mary fair, also known as Bandra fair, commenced on Sunday after a gap of two-year due to COVID-19 pandemic. The festival will be live-streamed through social media handles and multiple LED screens have been placed outside the church so that the public can watch the religious ceremonies. The fair will reportedly have around 430 shops and food courts.

381.title: 19-year-old Alcaraz wins US Open 2022, becomes youngest men's world number one in history
381.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz defeated 23-year-old Casper Ruud of Norway in the final to win US Open 2022 men's singles title. It's Alcaraz's first-ever Grand Slam title victory. He won the final with scoreline of 6-4, 2-6, 7-6(7-1), 6-3. Alcaraz has become the youngest men's world number one in tennis history, breaking Lleyton Hewitt's record (20 years and 9 months).

382.title: Was exhausted & burned out: Amala on taking break from films in 2019
382.article_body: Actress Amala Paul, speaking about her break from films in 2019, said that she did not "quit" films as her films weren't doing well or she wasn't getting offers. "I got the biggest offers of my career at that point...I had to say no because I simply needed a break," she stated. "I was tired, exhausted, burned out," she added.

383.title: Delhi records 137 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths
383.article_body: Delhi reported 137 fresh cases of COVID-19 and two deaths due to the infection in the past 24 hours, the city health department informed on Sunday. With the new cases, the city's active caseload stood at 717. Moreover, as per health department data, the national capital's COVID-19 death toll climbed to 26,493.

384.title: I agree with his anger: Real Madrid manager on Asensio's outburst
384.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti said he understands forward Marco Asensio's anger at not being brought in to play during their match against Mallorca. "I agree with him. It's normal, it means he wants to play...he has been the most affected," said Ancelotti. A video showing Asensio kicking and throwing bottles in the dugout during the match has gone viral.

385.title: Red Bull's Verstappen wins Italian GP, closes in on 2nd world title
385.article_body: Red Bull F1's Max Verstappen started seventh on the grid and went on to win the 2022 Italian GP to potentially be one win away from his second world championship. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc finished second, ahead of Mercedes' George Russell. Debutant Nyck de Vries scored his first points for Williams F1 in a race that ended behind the safety car.

386.title: Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan to win their 6th Asia Cup, their first since 2014
386.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by 23 runs in the final in Dubai to win Asia Cup for the sixth time. Bhanuka Rajapaksa top-scored for Sri Lanka in the final with 71*(45), while Pramod Madushan took four wickets and Wanindu Hasaranga took three wickets. It's Sri Lanka's first Asia Cup victory since 2014, when also they defeated Pakistan in the final.

387.title: Make sure the engine is right: Leclerc fumes at Ferrari F1 engineer
387.article_body: Ferrari F1 driver Charles Leclerc gave an angry reaction after his race engineer told him to be careful about the way he was shifting gears during the 2022 Italian Grand Prix. "I can't guys...Make sure the engine is right," said Leclerc, who finished second despite being on pole. The race ended with Leclerc 116 points behind championship leader Max Verstappen.

388.title: People of J&K against terrorism, helping police: LG Manoj Sinha
388.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said that the Union Territory is witnessing a change, and people are against terrorism and helping the police deal with it. He added that after revoking Article 370 in 2019, the situation changed and the backbone of terrorism was broken. "Earlier, peace was purchased, now it is established," Sinha said.

389.title: Death toll from migrant boat capsize off Tunisia rises to 11
389.article_body: The death toll from a migrant boat capsize last week off the coast of Tunisia in the Mediterranean Sea has risen to 11, the Tunisian state media reported on Sunday. The boat was carrying 37 people, out of which 14 have been rescued so far. As many as 12 occupants of the boat are still missing.

390.title: UP CM Adityanath announces ₹50 lakh ex-gratia to families of martyrs
390.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced ex-gratia of ₹50 lakh to family members of Army Jawan Naik Suraj Pal and Navy Jawan Haresh Kumar Singh. Expressing grief, CM Adityanath said that the government stands with the families of the departed soldiers. A government job will also be provided to one member each from their families.

391.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrives in Edinburgh after 6-hour journey
391.article_body: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrived in Edinburgh on Sunday after a six-hour journey from Balmoral Castle, her summer home in the Scottish Highlands. The coffin will remain overnight at the Palace of Holyroodhouse, Elizabeth's official Scottish residence. It will be taken to Edinburgh's St Giles Cathedral for a service on Monday. The queen's state funeral will be held on September 19.

392.title: Novak Djokovic will be allowed to play 2023 Australian Open: Reports
392.article_body: Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic will reportedly be able to play the Australian Open in 2023 despite not taking his COVID-19 vaccination. Djokovic was deported from Australia earlier this year, ahead of the tournament and given a three-year travel ban. Australia's new immigration minister has reportedly agreed to remove Djokovic's ban and allow him to compete in the Grand Slam.

393.title: Krejcikova complains of smelling weed during US Open doubles match
393.article_body: Czech Republic tennis player Barbora Krejcikova complained to the chair umpire that she could smell weed being smoked in the stands during her women's doubles semifinal match in the US Open. The umpire then gestured towards the crowd to not smoke inside the stadium. Earlier in the tournament, during a men's singles match, Nick Kyrgios also had a similar complaint.

394.title: Italian govt, UAE firm pick up 44% stake in Titagarh Wagons' subsidiary Firema
394.article_body: The Italian government and a UAE-based private equity firm, Hawk Eye DMCC, have together picked up nearly 44% stake in Titagarh Wagons’ fully-owned subsidiary Firema SpA. The Italian government picked 30.30% stake for 10 million euros, while Hawk Eye picked 13.64% stake for 4.5 million euros. The remaining 5.5 million euros was infused by a Titagarh Group company.

395.title: 4 of 6 criminals who escaped from jail lynched by mob in Meghalaya
395.article_body: Four of the six undertrial prisoners, who escaped from a jail in Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills on Saturday after overpowering prison guards, have allegedly been lynched by a mob in Shangpung village, Meghalaya DGP LR Bishnoi said. Bishnoi added that their bodies will be taken to hospital for identification. The mob had allegedly attacked the prisoners with rods and sticks.

396.title: You're a great champion: Lewandowski to fellow Pole Swiatek on her US Open win
396.article_body: Congratulating Iga Swiatek after she became the first-ever Polish woman to win the US Open, compatriot and Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski tweeted, "You're a great champion, and you've proven it yet again on the biggest stage." He added, "I am so happy for you!" World number one Swiatek defeated Ons Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5) in her maiden US Open final.

397.title: Saiyami, Gulshan Devaiah to star in a film produced by Anurag Kashyap
397.article_body: Actors Gulshan Devaiah and Saiyami Kher are teaming up for a film, which is being produced by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap. Speaking about reuniting with Gulshan after 'Unpaused Season 1', Saiyami said, "There is a comfort level working with him." She added that Gulshan is extremely creative and an amazing actor. The yet-untitled film is being shot in Hyderabad.

398.title: Govt planning to set up trade promotion body: Piyush Goyal
398.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has said the redesigning of the Commerce Department is under process. "We are in...process to redesign the structure of the Commerce Ministry and one of the ideas in front of us is to set up a 'trade promotion body'," he said. "[The]...body would be set up to devise an overall strategy to achieve targets," he added.

399.title: Steve Smith 'signals' free-hit after smashing six, video goes viral
399.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith smashed a six on bowling of New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham in the third ODI and immediately 'signalled' a free-hit. Smith made the free-hit gesture towards the umpires, indicating that the next ball should be a free hit as there were five fielders outside the 30-yard circle. "Steve Smith’s awareness is second to none," a commentator said.

400.title: Stuart Broad overtakes Glenn McGrath's tally of wickets in Test cricket
400.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad on Sunday became the second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket among fast bowlers. With his three-wicket haul in South Africa's second innings in the third Test, Broad took his tally of wickets in Test cricket to 566. He overtook former Australia fast bowler Glenn McGrath, who had taken 563 wickets in 124 Test matches.

401.title: Squid Game's Lee Jung-jae to star in 'Star Wars' series 'The Acolyte'
401.article_body: Lee Jung-jae, who starred in South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', has signed on to play the male lead in 'Star Wars' series 'The Acolyte'. Meanwhile, 'The Hunger Games' actress Amandla Stenberg has been roped in to play the female lead. 'The Acolyte' is set a century before the events of 'Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace'.
